resources.string: Elephants are large mammals that live in Africa and Asia. They often live in savannahs, deserts and forests. Elephants can live up to 70 years and weigh 7,000 kg.
Cows are large ungulates. Cows live everywhere in the world and they can weigh up to 600 kg. There are several species.
Lions are big cats that live in Africa and India. Lions live in prides in savannahs and forests. Lions can live up to 14 years.
A louise cat is an animal
Sea lions are sea mammals that have a lifespan of 20-30 years. A female sea lion weigh 100 kg and a male sea lion weigh 300 kg. Sea lions are very cute.
Cats live everywhere in the world. They can live up to 20 years. There are more than 70 species. Cats can be house cats or wildcats.
Bats are mammals that looks like flying mice. There are about 1,240 different species of bats. Bats live all around the world, except from cold places.
Ducks are often aquatic birds. Ducks often have orange peckers and flat fins. There are several species all around the world.
Owls exist all over the world, except Antarctica and some remote islands. There are over 200 different species in the world.
Parrots have 393 different species. Parrots live in tropical regions. Some parrots are able to talk.
Penguins are aquatic flightless birds. They live in the Southern Hemisphere. Adult penguins weigh 35 kg and live up to 20 years.
A rooster is a male chicken that often crows "cock-a-doodle-doo". The rooster's comb is red. The rooster live everywhere in the world.
